column5: Anyone know the cottage in question or have a picture of it?  I have rented a cottage on Chemong Lake a few years ago and am interested to see a picture of the cottage this occurred in.  Here is the article....  Charges laid after hidden cameras recorded people using cottage Chemong Lake cottage had cameras located inside and outside property (BUCKHORN) A 39-year-old Toronto man is facing voyeurism charges after a cottage rental party had cameras recording the activities of clients inside. According to Peterborough County OPP, on May 5 officers responded to reports of a voyeurism incident at a Chemong Lake address. OPP say the owner of a cottage on the lake, south of Buckhorn, rented the property out. He had security cameras mounted both outside and throughout the interior of the building, OPP say, and the cameras were connected to a DVR (digital video recorder), which recorded the activities of anyone renting the property. OPP were contacted when someone renting the cottage discovered the cameras. Derek C. James is charged with voyeurism and mischief by interfering with the lawful use and enjoyment of property  .

Never mind..I think I found it...I believe this is the advertisement of the cottage where this took place if anyone is interested.  http://www.vrbo.com/239987  and here is a google picture in case the ad is removed  http://www.google.ca/imgres?q=upper+james+manor+chemong+lake&um=1&hl=en&safe=active&sa=N&rlz=1R2ADFA_enCA480&biw=981&bih=556&tbm=isch&tbnid=U9pO5s20NR3klM:&imgrefurl=http://www.vrbo.com/239987&docid=sDQbtZ3lYT1WWM&imgurl=http://imagesus.homeaway.com/mda01/8c0f07c0-9bbb-4511-8b6c-a11cc3698421.1.12&w=400&h=300&ei=PvTqT9m7HvC20QHR6ozVBQ&zoom=1&iact=hc&vpx=392&vpy=136&dur=2250&hovh=194&hovw=259&tx=158&ty=124&sig=101573096497534417619&page=1&tbnh=112&tbnw=152&start=0&ndsp=15&ved=1t:429,r:2,s:0,i:78
He's probably renting it out cheap now (in case anyone was looking for a vacation spot)
Lol!  I was thinking the same thing.  $1500 is not too bad to begin with
Imagine being the family that rented that place..Thats horrible and oh so ignorant..Id be pissed if it were my family on that DVR..
I think that guy will feel safer in prison.

I was thinking of putting up a couple Wifi Cameras at my cottage and wondered about the legality behind it if in the future i rented it out.  I wouldnt of been hiding the cameras or placed them in bedrooms/washrooms and such... just the main area and front entrance.  Hmm
I would think if you disclosed the locations and reasons then it wouldn't be an issue.

I can understand exterior cameras when the cottage is unoccupied by owner or renter, as my family and friends have been victim of cottage break in's more than a few times  but the interior cameras is crossing the line on a rental property and at a minimum the renter should be informed of the exterior cameras when occupying the property...if it was my family/friends I'd request the camera's turned off while i was renting or find another rental  the legality behind this will be interesting to follow, I would assume the severity of the consequences will be dependent on the nature of the video footage retrieved, hopefully the owner's intentions/actions and whatever evidence/footage is retrieved isn't of a disturbing nature, that would be horrible for the families involved to deal with
some of the things that have gone on in cabins I have rented this guy wouldn't want to watch..
On his website he was charging $1.99 a min for live internet porn.

We rented an outpost cabin on Partridge Lk with access to Kesagami Lk from Ron Baron of Gardiner Air. The cabin had 2 obvious cameras, 1 inside, 1 outside, we were pretty sure they weren't functional and were just there as a deterent, but who knows, Ron was pretty particular about his stuff
It's too bad a perv owns a gorgeous property like that! I'd love to have something like that!
